text: Remove up to two cards from under any target, then if that target is a machine or base and has no cards under it, blow it up.
At the start of your turn, put the top card of your arsenal under this card. Then if this card has 2 or more cards under it, liquidate it and put those cards into your hand.

Requires 1 base

When this mook starts or joins an operation, you can exchange up to two cards from your hand with that many cards from under one of your blueprints.
Your scientists get +2 for each card under this base.
operation: Operation Welcome to Earth (16) — Put one of your machines under one of your bases, mooks, or blueprints. If you have no machines, hire a token mook instead.

text: This mook can't join operations, and other mooks can't join operations it starts.
operation: Operation Tip Goal (10) — For each enemy with more cards in hand than you, draw a card.

text: Exchange up to three cards from your hand with that many cards from under any of your blueprints.

Operations that target you or your mooks at home require an additional mook.

Whenever this base is blown up or liquidated, draw a card.

Requires 1 machine

Gets +2 for each card in your hand.

Your mooks can't be stolen.

The first time you declare an operation during your turn, you can have target enemy mook join that operation as if it was yours.
When this mook onboards, reveal the top five cards of your arsenal. Put a mook from among them into your hand and bottom the rest.
Whenever you assemble a blueprint, draw a card then discard a card.
When you fabricate this machine, target player tosses the top three cards of their arsenal.
Whenever this mook joins or leads an operation, draw a card.
operation: Operation Atomic Strength (20) — Assemble one of your blueprints, or put a card from under one of your blueprints into your hand.

text: If your active base would be blown up, you can blow up this base instead. You can use this ability if this isn't your active base.
This machine can act as an operative with threat level 8. (While it's an operative it counts as a mook)
Target mook gets -8 until end of turn.

Play this only when one of your unique mooks is blown up.

Blow up target mook, base, or machine. If you do, draw a card.
Your other mooks get +3.

operation: Operation Fire the Death Ray (20) — If this card has 4 or more machines under it, blow up any non-blueprint target. Then, if this card also has at least 1 base and least 1 scheme under it, you win the game.

text: Blow up target unique mook or target mook with threat level 8 or higher.
Mooks get -4 from poison until end of turn.

This machine can count toward one requirement of any type.

The first time you hire a mook that has a requirement during each turn, draw a card.
Whenever you would draw a card, you can liquidate this machine instead. If you do, search your arsenal for a blueprint and play it with this card under it, then shuffle.

When this mook onboards, put the top two cards of your arsenal under it.

This mook gets +2 for each card under it.

Requires 2 machines

Whenever you start an operation for the first time each turn, you can hire a token mook.

Discard or liquidate a mook as a cost.

Blow up target base, then draw a card.

Requires 1 mook, 1 machine

You can play a second scheme each turn.
When an operation targets you or your active base, you can liquidate this machine to stop it. You can use this ability if this machine is facedown by discarding a card as a cost.

operation: Operation Construct Device (20) — Assemble one of your blueprints.
factionAbility: You start the game with a blueprint from your arsenal in play. To assemble a blueprint, put the top card of your arsenal under it.
factionSpecificAbility: The first time you hire one or more token mooks each turn, you hire that many plus one instead.
factionFlavorText: Quickly, Igor, I need more victi-... test subj-... I need more willing participants!

text: You can play an extra scheme each turn.
Choose 2 of your machines and put them under another of your machines. You can trigger any of their fabrication effects.

Play only when you would lose the game because of an ability.

You don't lose. Search your arsenal for a base and play it as your new active base.

Requires 4 mooks

Whenever another of your nontoken mooks is blown up, hire a token mook.
Whenever an enemy targets one of your mooks, you can change the target to this mook. If you do, it gets +2 until end of turn.
Enemy schemes that target you, your mooks, your bases, or your machines have "Discard a card as a cost."
Immune to poison.
operation: Operation Onion Cloud (6) — Target mook gets -4 from poison until end of turn.

text: When this mook onboards, target player tosses the top three cards of their arsenal.

Whenever you would draw a card, you can liquidate this machine and a mook instead. If you do, reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a unique mook. Hire the revealed mook, ignoring its requirements, then bottom the rest.

When this mook onboards, fabricate a machine.

When you draw this card, you can reveal it to hire it.
When this mook onboards, remove up to two cards from under any target.
operation: Operation Launch Luncheon (8) — Assemble one of your blueprints.

text:
When this mook onboards, put the top 2 cards of your arsenal under it.

Whenever you would draw a card, you can put a card from under this card into your hand instead.
The first time you would draw a card each turn, instead look at the top card of your arsenal. You can toss that card. Then draw a card.

When you fabricate this machine, you can fabricate an additional machine this turn. This machine can act as an operative with threat level 2. When it joins an operation this way, draw a card.(While it's an operative it counts as a mook)
Until end of turn, your mooks have Operation Roll For Initiative (8) — Blow up target machine.
You can fabricate an additional machine each turn. When you do, draw a card.
Immune to poison, disease, and radiation.
Your active base can't be targeted. You can't change your active base except with abilities. Operation Move Out (5) — Change your active base to one of your other bases.

Requires turn 3 or later

Hire a mook from your hand, ignoring its requirements.

Put this card under target enemy mook and steal it. It can't start or join operations or use any abilities.

Whenever its owner would draw a card, they can have you draw two cards instead. If they do, put this card in the garbage pile and this ability ends.
Mooks in your hand have -1 to each of their requirements.
Requires 2 mooks
operation: Operation Berserk Rage (20) — Each enemy tosses the top 3 cards of their arsenal. For each machine tossed this way, blow up target machine.

text:
You can liquidate mooks instead of other card types to pay costs.

Whenever you liquidate one or more mooks, reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a mook. Put it into your hand and bottom the rest.
Hire a token mook, then if you have 3 or fewer mooks, hire another one.
This mook has threat level 6 and cannot be blown up by schemes or mooks.
Whenever you draw one or more cards, target mook gets -2 until end of turn for each card you drew.
Target mook becomes unique. Its owner tosses all other copies of it from their arsenal.
When this mook onboards, until your next turn, you can target enemies that can't be targeted.
operation: Operation Viral Post (10) — Target enemy reveals their hand and each of their facedown cards. Until your next turn, you can target that enemy's mooks, machines, and bases even if they can't be targeted.

text: When this mook onboards, assemble one of your blueprints.
Look at the top three cards of your arsenal. Hire one as a token mook, put one into your hand, and toss the last one.

Enemies can't target your blueprints or mooks.

Operations can't target you unless they have total threat level 30 or more.
Operation Field Trip (20) — Send away any number of target mooks. Until end of turn, they're scientists and have a great time.
Blow up target machine or facedown card.
Your mooks are also scientists.

You can fabricate this machine whenever you're targeted by an operation, but before operatives are selected.

Operations that target you can't include mooks with threat level 4 or lower.

Requires 1 machine

Your other Lasergun Enforcers get +2.
operation: Operation Laser Level (20) — For each Lasergun Enforcer operative, blow up target base or machine.

text: Onboarding abilities of mooks you onboard trigger twice.

Requires 2 mooks

This mook gets +2 for each of your machines.

operation: Operation Psychic Dominator (12) — Steal target mook with threat level lower than the number of cards under this card. Then if there are 8 or more mooks and they're all yours, you win the game.

text: Once per turn, whenever you hire a nontoken mook, hire a token mook.
Operation I Need Your Support (5) — Reveal the top card of your arsenal. If it's a scheme, put it into your hand.
Requires 4 or more schemes played this game
operation: Operation Plan For Domination (12) — Reveal cards from the top of your arsenal until you reveal a scheme. Put that card into your hand and bottom the rest.

text: This mook gets +2 for each of your other mooks.
operation: Operation Dine In (12) — Blow up target mook.

text: When this mook onboards, you can fabricate an additional machine this turn.

Operations can't target you unless they have 3 or fewer operatives.

Enemies can't target your machines or facedown cards.
Enemies can't target you except with operations of total threat level 20 or more.
operation: Operation Catapult Launch (20) — Stop an operation with lower total threat level than this one. You can use this operation in response to another one being started.
Operation Construct Device (20) — Assemble one of your blueprints.
factionAbility: You start the game with a blueprint from your arsenal in play. To assemble a blueprint, put the top card of your arsenal under it.
factionSpecificAbility: Whenever you fabricate a machine, your next operation this turn has -4 to its threat level cost.
factionFlavorText: My modification will increase the efficiency of the unilateral phase detractors by over three point seven two percent! I'll be unstoppable!

text:
Enemy mooks have +1 to each of their requirements.

Whenever you hire a nontoken mook, you can discard a card. If you do, hire a token mook.

Enemies can't target your other machines.

Whenever more than one of your other machines is blown up, you can bottom one of them instead of putting it into the garbage.

Requires turn 3 or later

Hire three token mooks.
Choose target enemy and name a card type. They reveal the top three cards of their arsenal. For each card of the chosen type revealed this way, draw a card. They toss those cards.
Draw two cards. If you performed your faction action this turn, draw three cards instead.
You can fabricate an additional machine during each of your turns.
When this mook onboards, bottom your hand and draw that many cards. If you didn't draw any cards this way, put the top card of your arsenal under one of your blueprints.

Requires 2 mooks, 2 machines

At the end of your turn, any player can discard a card. If no one does, blow up target machine and draw a card.
This mook can't be blown up.
Operation Pit Maneuver (6) — Reveal the top card of your arsenal. If it's a machine, put it facedown. If not, toss it.
Play only when a player hires a mook from their hand. That mook onboards as a token mook. (It's facedown, nameless, and has threat level 5 and no abilities.)

Play only when an enemy plays a scheme.

You choose the targets for that scheme. If it has no targets, you perform that scheme's actions instead.
Liquidate one of your machines, then remove up to three cards from under any target.

Requires 1 machine

Whenever an enemy starts an operation, this mook gets +2 until end of turn. Then, you can blow up target operative with equal or lower threat level.
When you fabricate this machine, put it under another machine. If you do, whenever that machine would be blown up, send this card to the garbage pile instead.
Each player liquidates a mook, base, or machine.
Toss cards from the top of your arsenal until you find a machine card. Put that card into your hand.
Reveal the top four cards of your arsenal. Put all the schemes among those cards into your hand, and toss the rest. You can play another scheme this turn.
Search your arsenal for a machine or for a mook with threat level 5 or less. Put it into your hand. Then, toss two cards from the top of your arsenal.
Lone Operative (This mook can lead any of your operations by itself)
operation: Operation Die Another Day (5) — Remove a card from under any target.

text:
Play only when you're targeted for an operation.

Blow up target operative. Draw a card.
Whenever one of your mooks becomes the target of an ability, you can return that mook to your hand.
Target player liquidates their mook with the lowest threat level.
At the start of your turn, you can liquidate this machine. If you do, blow up target machine or base.
When this mook onboards, steal target machine.
When you fabricate this machine, look at the top three cards of your arsenal and put them back in any order.

Discard a card as a cost.

Draw three cards.

Requires 3 mooks

When you complete your first operation each turn, repeat it with the same operatives.
operation: Operation Cooperation (12) — Assemble one of your blueprints, then draw a card.
Operation Construct Device (20) — Assemble one of your blueprints.
factionAbility: You start the game with a blueprint from your arsenal in play. To assemble a blueprint, put the top card of your arsenal under it.
factionSpecificAbility: Whenever a player plays a scheme that targets one or more of your blueprints, draw a card.
factionFlavorText: I will destroy the entire city, unless you pay me... one million dollars! No, one billion dollars!

text: Operations this mook starts have -4 to their costs.
Liquidate a machine as a cost. Blow up target mook.
When this mook returns home for the first time each turn, draw a card.
operation: Operation The Big One (20) — Target enemy reveals the top card of their arsenal. If it's a scheme, you can play it. If it's a mook, you can hire it. If it's a machine, you can put it facedown.

text: Search your arsenal for up to three machines. Choose one of them in secret and put it facedown. After you shuffle, put one of the remaining cards on top and bottom the rest.
Steal target mook until your next turn, or until it's targeted by an enemy operation. As long as it's yours, it can't start or join operations and your other mooks can't be targeted.
Fabricate a number of target machines equal to your current turn count or 3, whichever is lower.
Search your arsenal for a base and put it into your hand. You can't play bases with that name this turn.
When this mook onboards, hire a token mook.
At the start of your turn, you can liquidate a machine. If you do, draw a card.
operation: Operation Flood the Overworld (18) — For each operative, flip up to one target machine facedown.

text: Whenever an enemy starts an operation, you can liquidate this machine. If you do, stop that operation, and that player can't start any more operations this turn.
Blow up target machine, then draw a card. Then discard a card if it wasn't your machine.

operation: Operation Form Giant Robot (10) — Remove every non-machine card from under this card, then if this card has exactly 6 machines under it remove them all and it becomes a mook with threat level 32 and has "whenever this mook joins an operation, you may have target player lose the game."

text:
Immune to scientists

Schemes your enemies play require 1 mook.
Whenever an enemy targets you with an operation, if this mook is at home, you can liquidate it instead to stop that operation.
When this mook onboards, blow up every mook. Until end of turn, whenever a mook onboards, it's blown up by radiation.

Your Scientists get +2.

Your operatives can't be targeted by schemes or mooks.
operation: Operation It Belongs In A Museum (6) — Draw a card, then discard a card.

text: Until end of turn, operations your mooks start or join can't be stopped.
